poem:
Title: "A Morning's Political Stir"

In the ink-stained lens of morning news,
Labour bathes in the guise of a victor's muse.
A stinging rebuke to hues of Tory blues,
In the rustle of papers, a government's ruse.

The whispering call for resignation stirs,
Bannerman, his voice no longer a blur.
Sunak, your turn to melancholically concur,
A political ballet, elegantly demur.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Starmer hails ‘incredible’ swing as Labour wins byelection and Tories suffer heavy losses in local elections – live 10.04am BST As Ben Riley-Smith from the Telegraph reports, David Campbell Bannerman, chair of the Conservative Democratic Organisation and a former MEP (for both Ukip and the Tories) has said Rishi Sunak should quit. **NEW**David Campbell Bannerman, the ex-Tory MEP and chairman of the Conservative Democratic Organisation, calls on Rishi Sunak to resign.He tells @Telegraph: “Once again". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Starmer hails ‘incredible’ swing as Labour wins byelection and Tories suffer heavy losses in local elections – live 10.04am BST As Ben Riley-Smith from the Telegraph reports, David Campbell Bannerman, chair of the Conservative Democratic Organisation and a former MEP (for both Ukip and the Tories) has said Rishi Sunak should quit. **NEW**David Campbell Bannerman, the ex-Tory MEP and chairman of the Conservative Democratic Organisation, calls on Rishi Sunak to resign.He tells @Telegraph: “Once again
